condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Selected ministries, departments, and agencies, local government authorities, and non-state actors deliver increased quality of HIV/AIDS care and treatment services

description.narrative: Access to quality pediatric ART treatment for children remains a challenge with only 40% of children under age 15 with HIV on ART treatment. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/07/2016

title.narrative: # of health care facilities providing comprehensive care and treatment services
% of Health Facilities that have trained staff delivering youth-friendly services according to national guidelines

baseline.value: Iringa(5.6%), Mufindi (0%), Mbeya (7.0%), Mbarali (19.0%), Makete (45%), Njombe (1.4%)

title.narrative: % of children under 2 years HIV infected and on ART

baseline.value: National 17% Iringa NA, Mufindi 7%, Njombe 12%, Makete 6%,Mbarali 1%,Mbeya 6%

actual.value: 2016:The current data system does not provide age disaggregated data. However, 38% of children under 15 years are on ART

title.narrative: % of infants born to women living with HIV/AIDS who receive virologic testing within 2 months of birth

actual.value: 2016:82% of children born to women living with HIV/AIDS received virologic testing
